title: Professional Front-end UI Development
author: James A. Pickering
headline: Creating highly interactive and mobile-friendly websites and applications
about: James is a Senior UI developer with a natural flair for creative problem solving, he is a specialist in the field of front-end web development aimed at users of desktop computers and mobile devices. He has built highly interactive solutions for top name brands such as Wren Kitchens, JD Sports, and JD Williams. James has worked with numerous Agile teams as an advocate for user needs and applying UX principles in everything that he does. In the last 6 years he has kept up to date with JavaScript and React JS. Leveraging out of the box performance and usability benefits from these tools. He learns something new from every project, sharing his expertise and bringing fresh insights to new projects.
contact: Reach out to me me on Github or LinkedIn if you have questions or feedback about any of the topics I cover on this website.

kidsloop.title: KidsLoop Coding Assignment
kidsloop.desc: In October 2021, KidsLoop briefed me to recreate a sign-in page design using a DOM rendering framework.
kidsloop.body: The finished responsive design should scale across a range of screen resolutions and devices. Add a dark / light theme toggle and switch between two icons. Shown in the slider opposite are slides from the final demo, which included support for multi language translation and accessibility.

qbots.title: qEnergy Dashboard
qbots.desc: Smart energy dashboards for energy saving analytics
qbots.body: I developed smart energy dashboards for SME and Enterprise customers offering insights and savings predictions based on energy usage data collected over day and monthly periods.

wrenkitchens.title: Wren Kitchens Planner 2D
wrenkitchens.desc: Bespoke software development for Switch and Save
wrenkitchens.body: In 2022 I worked on Switch and Save, a price comparison tool for Planner 2D used by the Kitchen Designers in showrooms to walk the customer through a series of design choices. Based on the appliances they picked they will be shown a set of cheaper base units or appliances. For example the 3D render shown opposite is refreshed behind the scenes after the user confirms a selected appliance in Switch and Save, which is then updated in design choices. Finally when the customer views the basket page they will be able to see a summary of the material and unit costs.

skills.title: HTML5
skills.subtitle: Hypertext Markup Language
skills.desc: HTML5 is a markup language and related technologies used for structuring and presenting web content. Web browsers interprets the HTML5 tags and attributes and converts them into human readable web pages. I've used it together with CSS and JavaScript to develop content for e-commerce websites and web applications.

skills.title: CSS
skills.subtitle: Cascading style sheets
skills.desc: I use CSS to enable the separation of presentation and content, including layout, colours and fonts. CSS is a cornerstone technology of the web which is constantly evolving in scope and features, alongside HTML and JavaScript.

skills.title: SASS
skills.subtitle: Syntactically Awesome Stylesheets
skills.desc: SASS is a syntax pre-processor for CSS. It has useful features that aren’t supported in regular CSS such as nesting, mixins, and modules that help you write clean and maintainable CSS code.

skills.title: Javascript
skills.subtitle: Javascript programming
skills.desc: JavaScript usually abbreviated as JS, is a high level programming language that conforms to the ECMA Script specification.  It has dynamic typing, object-oriented features, and functions are first-class citizens. It has evolved from from humble beginnings in the 1990s into a hugely popular web development ecosystem that consists of Node, Node package manager and frameworks such as React, Angular and Vue to name just a few.

skills.title: React JS
skills.subtitle: React JS Library
skills.desc: React usually abbreviated as React, is a free and open-source JavaScript library for building user interfaces with composable UI components. Its key selling point is its faster re-rendering of HTML document elements. It is maintained by Facebook and a community of developers and companies. I use React in the development of single-page applications or mobile web applications.

skills.title: Node JS
skills.subtitle: Node.js
skills.desc: Node.js is a JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 JavaScript engine. As an asynchronous event-driven JavaScript runtime, Node.js is designed to build scalable network applications.

skills.title: REST APIs
skills.subtitle: Representational State Transfer
skills.desc: REST or Representational State Transfer is a process for distributed network systems. REST APIs are typically used to make asynchronous requests to fetch data from servers and post data from a contact form or sign up form.
